page.title: 14ISOLATED COMMUNITY
page.content: The Domesday block is a very isolated area with only scattered farmhouses and edges of settlements of Braithwaite,Laycock and Sutton.There are no bus routes.The nearest shopping town is Keighley with chain stores, banks and supermarkets.Each of the villages does have its own limited shopping facilities with grocery stores and post offices.Bradford is the nearest city and can be reached by train or bus from Keighley. For the children living close to Sutton or Steeton each of these villages has its own primary school and at the age of 11 they progress to South Craven School,Cross Hills. Braithwaite also has its own primary school and pupils progress to Highfield Middle School and Greenhead Grammar School in Keighley.
